title: Junior Data Scientist
via: via Oil And Gas Job Search
description:
Company Description

We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.

Job Description
â€¢ Under supervision, executes project plans for timely project completion.
â€¢ Utilizes statistical and machine learning techniques to create high-performing models that comply with regulatory and privacy requirements and address business objectives and client needs.
â€¢ Performs analyses of structured and unstructured data to solve multiple and complex business problems. utilizing advanced statistical, mathematical and machine learning technique.
â€¢ Tests new statistical analysis methods, software and data sources for continual improvement of quantitative solutions. Implements as needed.
â€¢ Creates clear and easy to understand documents for product support (technical).
â€¢ Presents analysis ideas, progress reports and results to... internal managers, project managers.
â€¢ Collaborates with other Data Scientists to develop technical/business approaches and new or enhanced technical tools. Participates in collaborations for implementation.

Qualifications
â€¢ Graduate-level degree preferred with concentration in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, mathematics, economics, operations research, computer science or aligned discipline.
â€¢ Experience with data engineering, core data science analytic methodologies, and text mining.
â€¢ Knowledge in and applied experience with statistical and machine learning.
â€¢ Experience (0-2 years) using machine learning languages (e.g., R, Python, SLQ) and a working familiarity with cloud computing environments.
â€¢ Logical, evidence-based problem solving and critical thinking skills.
â€¢ Knowledge of time-series based methods is a plus.
â€¢ Knowledge of basic insurance concepts is a plus.

Additional Information

In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to WorkÂ® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Weâ€™re also one of the 38 companies on the UKâ€™s Best Workplacesâ„¢ list and one of 18 companies on Spainâ€™s Best Workplacesâ„¢ list.

For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable.

Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. Weâ€™re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows.

Everyone at Veriskâ€”from our chief executive officer to our newest employeeâ€”is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate.

title: Scientist- Data Engineering
description:
AXA XL recognizes digital, data and information assets are critical for the business, both in terms of managing risk and enabling new business opportunities. Data Science and Applied AI assets should not only be high quality, but also drive a sustained competitive advantage and delivering a superior experience to our internal, external customers and improving efficiency. Our Data, Analytics & Intelligence function is focused on driving innovation by optimizing how we leverage digital, data and AI to drive strategy and differentiate ourselves from the competition.

As we develop an enterprise-wide data and digital strategy that moves us toward greater focus on the use of data and strengthen our digital, AI capabilities, we are seeking a Lead Data and MLOps Engineer. In this role, you will research and apply engineering best practice and latest technology to lead physical design for data layers, evolve ways of working to support rapid growth in data inventory as well as variety and... number of deployed data science applications. The platform is expected to enable scalable data acquisition and transformation, BI and web app serving, insight generation, full data and ML engineering lifecycle including controlled deployment to production and ongoing monitoring and operations.

Our tech stack continues to evolve: Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure Synapse, Power BI, Collibra, Databricks, MLflow, RStudio, Harness CI/CD, OpenShift, GitHub, JIRA

DISCOVER your opportunity

What will your essential responsibilities include?
â€¢ Act as a data engineering expert and partner to Global Technology and data consumers in controlling complexity and cost of the data platform, whilst enabling performance, governance, and maintainability of the estate.
â€¢ Understand current and future data consumption patterns, partner with Architects and Global Technology to ensure optimal design of data layers. For example, balance between materialization and virtualization, optimal level of de-normalization, caching and partitioning strategies, choice of storage and querying technology.
â€¢ Collaborate with data governance and information security in evolving data access and permissions patterns to enable optimal consumer experience that is secure and compliant with the enterprise standards and audit requirements.
â€¢ Leading and hands-on execution of research into new technologies such as Delta tables, graph databases, observability solutions. Formulating frameworks for assessment of new technology vs business benefit, implications for data consumers.
â€¢ Act as a best practice expert, blueprint creator of ways of working such as testing, logging, CI/CD, observability, release lifecycle, enabling rapid growth in data inventory and utilization of Data Science Platform.
â€¢ Partner with Technical Product Owner for Data Science Platform and user community to achieve optimal end-to-end data science & actuarial user experience: from accessing data to creating, testing, deploying, and monitoring artifacts in production.
â€¢ Provide support to Machine Learning and Data Science community in scaling value of their work through automation and engineering. Advise on engineering best practice and skill gaps where necessary.
â€¢ Manage and provide technical leadership to a small team (1-3 initially) of software developers, data engineers and MLOps engineers in growing utilization and impact of the enterprise data platform offering.

In this role, you will report to the Division Lead, Data Science Platforms.

SHARE your talent

Weâ€™re looking for someone who has these abilities and skills:
â€¢ Senior Data Engineering professional with hands-on skills in designing, building, and optimizing scalable cost-efficient data systems and applications in a cloud-first environment.
â€¢ Expert in engineering ways of working such as CI/CD, release lifecycle, data observability, data testing, continuous model validation with tangible track record of instituting change.
â€¢ Programming experience in Python or Scala. Familiarity with all, and expert in some of the below: SQL, Databricks or Spark, MPP databases, data warehouse design, feature store design, Kubernetes, orchestration tools, monitoring tools, IaC, Docker, streaming technologies.
â€¢ Solid understanding of data science value chain, experience of working next to an ML team. Experience of hands-on machine learning engineering would be an advantage.
â€¢ 7+ years of experience as a Data Engineer / Software Engineer / ML Engineer on an open-source tech stack with Python, Scala, Spark, Hadoop / cloud platforms, MPP database technologies.
â€¢ Ideally, management experience leading multiple projects, colleagues, and execution partners

FIND your future

AXA XL, the P&C and specialty risk division of AXA, is known for solving complex risks. For mid-sized companies, multinationals and even some inspirational individuals we donâ€™t just provide re/insurance, we reinvent it.

How? By combining a strong and efficient capital platform, data-driven insights, leading technology, and the best talent in an agile and inclusive workspace, empowered to deliver top client service across all our lines of business âˆ’ property, casualty, professional, financial lines and specialty.

With an innovative and flexible approach to risk solutions, we partner with those who move the world forward.

Inclusion & Diversity

At AXA XL, we know that an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce enable business growth and are critical to our success. Thatâ€™s why we have made a strategic commitment to attract, develop, advance and retain the most diverse workforce possible, while creating an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and can reach their highest potential. Itâ€™s about helping one another â€” and our business â€” to move forward and succeed.
â€¢ Five Business Resource Groups focused on gender, LGBTQ+, race/ethnicity, disability and inclusion with 20 Chapters around the globe
â€¢ Robust support for Flexible Working Arrangements
â€¢ Enhanced family friendly leave benefits
â€¢ Named to the Diversity Best Practices Index
â€¢ Signatory to the UK Women in Finance Charter

Corporate Responsibility

At AXA XL our approach to corporate responsibility (CR) is the same as our approach to business; constantly seeking to provide innovative solutions to the worldâ€™s most complex problems. From offering our expertise, products and services to help build more resilient communities, to advancing understanding and response to climate change, our strategy â€“ Our Impact. Our Future. â€“ aligns key issues that are pertinent to our business â€“ climate, water and financial resilience - and contributes to AXA Groupâ€™s purpose to â€œAct for human progress by protecting what matters.â€.
â€¢ Climate: Weâ€™re reducing our carbon footprint, protecting ecosystems and exploring how our business can help build a better world.
â€¢ Water: Weâ€™re developing water resilience where it is â€” and will be â€” needed most.
â€¢ Financial resilience: Weâ€™re helping create opportunities for the unemployed and underemployed, so they can be better prepared for unexpected changes.

Hearts in Action:We have established volunteering and charitable giving programs to help colleagues support causes that matter most to them, known as our â€œHearts in Actionâ€ programs

title: Data Analyst - Gamma Retail Catalyst
description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

BCG is seeking a Data Analyst, based in Warsaw, Poland. You will join the rapidly growing Retail Catalyst team, which helps build and implement advanced analytics software for our Retail case teams and clients. Retail Catalyst is part of BCG GAMMA, BCGâ€™s data science and software products business unit. The Warsaw-based team is in charge of building, configuring, and delivering world-class analytics software and apps.

In particular, you will be in charge of:
â€¢ Supporting the Customer Success Managers (CSMs) to deliver excellent and seamless client delivery service
â€¢ Rapidly take responsibility for expanding / improving use cases and help our clients achieve their analytics goals
â€¢ Developing, customizing, and performance-tuning Tableau dashboards
â€¢ Building and maintaining ETL flows in Dataiku
â€¢ Overseeing and executing client data ingestion and data quality control
â€¢ Performing analytics to support the software / apps and generating insights
â€¢ Providing technical... solution and domain expertise to our clients and case teams
â€¢ Coordinating with clients / case teams and maintaining a close sync with our engineering, data science, and devops teams
â€¢ Proactively collecting and incorporating client and case team feedback to make the Retail Catalyst platform the best it can be
â€¢ Over time, become a leader of the Warsaw Retail Catalyst team and take on management responsibility

JOB REQUIREMENTS:
The Data Analyst will have two major areas of responsibilities:
Client Service (80%)
â€¢ Support onsite Customer Success Managers (CSMs) to successfully deliver Retail Catalyst projects
â€¢ Work directly with clients, BCG case teams, and product team on a project-by-project basis to conduct hands-on rigorous quantitative analysis, leveraging advanced analysis software (e.g., Dataiku and Tableau for visualization)
â€¢ Ingest, clean, transform, maintain, and analyze client data on Retail Catalyst platform
â€¢ Rapidly configure standard and custom Tableau dashboards per CSM, client, and case teamâ€™s directions / requirements
â€¢ Oversee and quality-control all things ETL and Tableau for our client deployments
â€¢ Coordinate the Warsaw delivery team to provide world-class quality output and hyper-responsive client service
Product and IP development (20%)
â€¢ Maintain library of client-agnostic Tableau dashboards and ETL flows
â€¢ Improve setup and preparation of standard / starting point components so that they can be rapidly deployed and configured for client use cases
â€¢ Support Retail Catalyst product team in client development efforts with ad hoc analysis, problem solving on best analytical approach, and client demos
â€¢ Study and understand Retail sector terminology and industry (analytics-) knowledge
â€¢ Over time, identify new areas of application/use cases for Retail Catalyst and help embed these into the platform and apps
Your success in this role will be measured in your ability to support our clients and case teams with highly responsive and top quality outputs. You will also be measured on your level of proactivity in terms of improving and expanding the technical platforms and analytical use cases. Finally, we will expect you to, over time, take responsibility for the Warsaw team, including development and mentorship for junior team members and overall quality control
YOU'RE GOOD AT

Technical skills
â€¢ Tableau (Advanced / World class)
â€¢ ETL / SQL (Advanced / World class)
â€¢ Excel (Advanced)
â€¢ Statistics and math (Intermediate)
â€¢ Python knowledge is a plus
â€¢ Data automation knowledge (e.g., Airflow) is a plus
â€¢ Cloud knowledge (Google Cloud and Azure) is a plus

Non-technical skills
â€¢ Meticulous attention to detail
â€¢ Highly efficient â€“ you get a lot of work done in very little time
â€¢ Willingness to work hard and prioritize team success vs. regular working hours
â€¢ Highly proactive and strong drive for (self-) improvement
â€¢ Dedicated team player
â€¢ Excellent communication skills in English
â€¢ World class problem-solving skills
â€¢ Self-motivated and is able to operate autonomously in a structured manner
â€¢ Ability to coach others
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)

Education or Certifications
â€¢ Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in engineering, computer science, data science / statistics, or business administration

Work Experience
â€¢ Minimum of 2 years of deep experience in Tableau, including Tableau server tuning, Tableau APIs, Hyper, recent and upcoming product innovations, etc.
â€¢ Minimum of 2 years of deep experience in ETL for very large data sets (terabyte+)
â€¢ Deep expertise in SQL, ideally PostgreSQL
â€¢ Experience in conducting thorough quality checks on ETL flows
â€¢ Experience with data ingestion and automation of ingestion is a big plus
â€¢ Experience with visualized ETL tools (Alteryx, Dataiku) is a big plus
â€¢ Experience in working with global teams
â€¢ Client service experience is a plus
â€¢ Cloud platform experience is a plus
YOU'LL WORK WITH

â€¢ Client success team
â€¢ Tableau delivery team
â€¢ Devops team
â€¢ Product engineering and platform team
â€¢ Commercial and product leadership

title: Data Scientist
description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else â€“ with class, logical thinking and lots of style ðŸ˜Ž Letâ€™s break it... down: we take the most complex problems and create tailor-made solutions for our customers ðŸš€ If youâ€™re thinking the Data team is kept in some sort of a secret den, doomed to never see the impact of their work, donâ€™t worry - thatâ€™s not how we do things. Theyâ€™re some of our best and brightest problem-solvers, deployed to the front lines to work in product teams and deliver rockstar solutions ðŸ¤˜

We start with deep data analysis to understand our customers, their objectives and any issues they might have. We then use various data points and advanced machine learning algorithms, to come up with the best possible option for each client. We experiment, iterate and build fully automated solutions, based on algorithms which self-improve with time.

Weâ€™re looking for next-level Data Scientists to board our FinTech rocket ship and shape the future of financial services apps. Phew! Itâ€™s a big task, but you wonâ€™t do it alone. ðŸ’ª

Youâ€™ll be working with the toughest and most gifted professionals in Product, Design, Data Science and Engineering, on impactful projects thatâ€™ll make our company move forward â©

What Youâ€™ll Be Doing
â€¢ Improving existing algorithms and building new Proofs of Concept
â€¢ Delivering real impact to the product through rigorous data-driven solutions
â€¢ Researching and then delivering PoCs into data products
â€¢ Collaborating with product owners, engineers and data scientists to continually solve complex data problems

What You'll Need
â€¢ Experience building and leading a significant data science team within a scaling organisation
â€¢ Bachelor's/Master's/PhD in STEM (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering)
â€¢ Excellent knowledge of data science tools, including, python coding, SQL and production tools.
â€¢ Deep understanding of fundamentals of probability and statistics.
â€¢ Big picture thinking - correctly diagnosing problems and productionising research.
â€¢ Excellent communication and collaboration skills to partner with Product Owners and business heads

Nice to have
â€¢ Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Masters or PhD)
â€¢ Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++â€¦)
â€¢ Previous experience in anti fraud departments
â€¢ Experience working at a large tech company worth >$15B
â€¢ School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming

Building a global financial super app isnâ€™t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and thatâ€™s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. Weâ€™re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. Thatâ€™s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

title: Software Engineer, DevOps
description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

We are seeking an exceptional and experienced candidate to serve as DevOps Engineer for Retail Catalyst. This high-impact role will work directly with Developers, Data Scientists, Data Architects, other DevOps, Product Managers, Client Success Managers, and vendor partners (Google, Microsoft, Tableau, etc.) to own, define, improve, and implement Retail Catalystâ€™s DevOps roadmap. He or she will also play a crucial role in ensuring a smooth delivery of client projects, including the very important task of monitoring and improving our cloud-based platform and apps.
YOU'RE GOOD AT

You have lots of passion for cloud platforms, digital apps, and (large dataset) automation. At the same time, you also think of how to improve the business / processes and where and how you can utilize your skills to help streamline the current state of engineering & infrastructure. You should also have a relentless focus on delivering superior client service and making / keeping your... stakeholders happy.

â€¢ Thoroughly understanding DevOps processes and tools like JIRA, Confluence, Octopus, Splunk, etc.
â€¢ Knowing and being very comfortable with Tableau Server including setup, maintenance, user management, performance tuning, upgrades, etc.
â€¢ Bringing deep experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure, and/or AWS â€“ ideally in settings with very large (= billions of rows) of data
â€¢ Bringing experience with Spark Cluster maintenance and performance tuning (especially auto-scaling)
â€¢ Being on top of the latest security best practices and how to implement strong security / DevSecOps
For more information on BCG please log onto:
â€¢ Setting up Various Pipelines on Azure DevOps, especially automated deployments
â€¢ Supporting the upgrade and maintenance of data platforms and cloud infrastructure (Dev and Prod)
â€¢ Automating and proactively improving operations around environment provisioning, installation, upgrade and maintenance
â€¢ Architecting, developing, and deploying tools for monitoring, logging, and alerting
â€¢ Conducting hands-on troubleshooting, problem analysis and resolution
â€¢ Supporting the software engineers in building a stronger a CI/CD pipeline using tools such as Gitlab, Octopus, Skaffold (GCP), etc
â€¢ Retail industry / data experience is a plus
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)

â€¢ Passion for providing world-class service levels to our clients and internal stakeholders (some of them very senior)
â€¢ Experience and proven success in working with fast moving, globally distributed tech teams and going above and beyond (including flexing your working hours) to make things happen
â€¢ Bachelors/Masterâ€™s degree in software engineering, computer science, mathematics, or related field
â€¢ Experience in deploying / maintaining data platforms & software solutions (ideally GCP and Azure â€“ AWS experience also a plus)
â€¢ Experience working on cloud-based services (including SaaS, PaaS, IaaS) with a solid understanding of continuous integration, delivery and deployment challenges, Configuration management best practices for developing and deploying cloud applications.
â€¢ Deep understanding of latest DevOps tooling and practices (Atlassian JIRA, Confluence, Gitlab, OctopusDeploy, Splunk, etc.)
â€¢ High proficiency with monitoring tools

YOU'LL WORK WITH

Our technology consultants and specialists partner with our clients and colleagues to build and implement digital solutions through a broad spectrum of activities. Technology jobs and engineering jobs include design of IT architectures, large-scale transformation, agile development, software engineering, cybersecurity consulting, and risk management
